comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The Empress of Ireland ran between Liverpool and Quebec. See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RMS_Empress_of_Ireland It seems a pity that you haven't uploaded the descriptions from your own site, e.g., " Description: Cabin interior on the passenger liner 'Empress of Ireland' (1906) showing the Duke of Connaught's Bedroom, part of a First Class suite on the starboard side of the Lower Promenade Deck. Prince Arthur, 1st Duke of Connaught and Strathearn (1850-1942) was appointed Governor General of Canada in October 1911. This photograph shows one of the staterooms on the 'Empress of Ireland' adapted to accommodate the Duke and Duchess of Connaught on their journey to Canada. The ship departed from Liverpool on 6 October 1911. The Royal apartments were decorated by A. Blain & Sons, Paradise Street, Liverpool." www.nmm.ac.uk/collections/explore/object.cfm?ID=G10655 See www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/tags/dukeofconn... for a couple of pictures relating to the Duke of Connaught in the Library of Congress collection of glass negatives in the Bain Collection. In January 1912, he paid a visit to the United States.

comment.author: 11334970@N05
comment._content: We thought hard about what information to upload with our images, and we decided to keep the contextual description to a minimum so that we'd give the Flickr community a wide scope in interpreting and researching the images themselves.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The New York Times noted the start and finish of the voyage of the Empress of Ireland that carried the Duke of Connaught to Canada as Governor General. The Duke was still in that office when the liner sank after a collision in the St. Lawrence in fog with over 1,000 drowned. See, for example: October 7, 1911, Saturday query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9407E7D71131E233A... CONNAUGHT SAILS.; Duke En Route for Canada to Assume Governor Generalship. October 13, 1911, Friday query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9801E4D61531E233A... DUKE OF CONNAUGHT ARRIVES IN CANADA; New Governor General Reaches Quebec, but Remains on Board the Liner. May 30, 1914, Saturday query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9507EED8173AE633A... SHAUGHNESSY ON TRAGEDY.; Canadian Pacific's President Says There Were Plenty of Lifeboats. May 31, 1914, Sunday query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9503EFDC1F39E633A... THANKS FROM CONNAUGHT.; Mayor Receives Reply to His Message of Sympathy. The tragedy was written up quickly in The Tragic Story of the Empress of Ireland by Logan Marshall. See books.google.com/books?id=d5ETAAAAYAAJ
